title: ACS: Auto-Tuning the Configurations of Structured Streaming Programs by Using SVM
abstract: Recently, Apache Structured Streaming (ASS) has been released with many benefits such as supporting incremental query models and end-to-end applications, integrating with Spark SQL engine, and etc. However, ASS has a huge amount of configuration parameters needing to be set properly, which is critical for performance. And it is extremely difficult, if feasible, to manually tune these configuration parameters for optimal performance. In this paper, we propose ACS to tune the configuration of Apache Structured Streaming programs automatically. ACS includes two key technologies: 1) Support Vector Machine (SVM) is leveraged to accurately build a performance model; 2) Genetic Algorithm (GA) is employed to realise the optimal configurations searching. We adopt four typical structured streaming programs for performance evaluation. The results show that compared to the default configurations recommended by official guidelines, ACS improves the throughput by an average of 2.29× and up to 2.52×, and reduces the latency by an average of 3.08× and up to 3.96×.
